4. Adaptability: Being adaptable in the workplace means being able to adjust and respond to changes and challenges in a positive and proactive manner. This is an important quality for a designer as the design industry is constantly evolving and new technologies are emerging. A designer who is adaptable is able to quickly adjust their design process to meet the changing needs of clients and adapt to new technologies. This can include being open to learning new software and design techniques, as well as being able to work with different design styles and mediums.

Adaptability is also important in a designer's work with clients. A designer who is adaptable is able to respond to feedback and make changes to their designs based on the client's needs. This shows that the designer is professional, flexible, and dedicated to creating a high-quality design that meets the client's needs.

In addition, adaptability is key in working with a team. A designer who is adaptable is able to work effectively with a team of designers, developers, and other professionals. This includes being able to effectively communicate ideas and feedback, and work together to achieve a common goal.

Overall, adaptability is an essential quality for a designer to possess in order to succeed in the constantly changing design industry. (Source: "Adaptability in the Workplace: Why it Matters and How to Develop it" by HBR, "The Importance of Adaptability in Design" by AIGA)
